sub_title: Incoming MPP Candidate at Sciences Po Paris and Hertie School ✔ Co-Founder of Global Studies Community ✔ Young European Ambassador ✔ Editing and writing for Res Publica
summary:
Often we give up too quickly to find a solution because the problems seem to be too complicated. I believe that it needs interdisciplinary approaches to face wicked problems. This is why I am passionate about studying the BSc Global Studies in Maastricht, a truly interdisciplinary program that gives me insights into different disciplines such as law, economics, psychology and data science.

Too often academic disciplines compete with each other instead of cooperating to implicate their findings into efficient policies. But why is interdisciplinarity so important? Because no discipline has all answers and is only a part by definition. Bringing disciplines together allows us to access a wider variety of ways to consider solutions for ongoing challenges.

My time as a professional athlete taught me how important it is to work together in a team to be successful. I am enjoying working together with people who share the same interests and visions as I do. I am eager to learn as well as to bring in already gained experience into all different kinds of projects.

treasury_media.title: Meet the Organisation Team: Vincent Tadday
treasury_media.description: "Too often, when discussing how policy can guide societal decisions and achieve rational outcomes, we get stuck in the same discussions that might not allow us to think out of the box. I joined the organisation team of the Critical Policy Lab because I wanted to be a part of organising a platform that allows students to explore policy discourses of the mainstream. I look forward to a day of exciting discussions and great opportunities to expand my horizons!"

treasury_media.title: Vincent Tadday winner of the green and digital essay competition
treasury_media.description: In 2022, with the support of the ‘EU-ASEAN Think Tank dialogues for strategic partnerships’ project, the Clingendael Institute and the Cambodian Institute for Cooperation and Peace (CICP) organised an essay competition for students and recent graduates. The essays were judged by the project team along the lines of feasibility of ideas, creativity, writing style and the originality of the perspective the essay provides. The elected winners are Vincent Tadday, Hidde Wams and Anggi Putri.

treasury_media.title: Interview Vincent Tadday, Co-Founder of the Global Studies Community. — Res Publica
treasury_media.description: Last week we interviewed Vincent Tadday, who co-founded an association dedicated to interdisciplinary thinking and working. Vincent is taking us by hand and showing what it takes to represent students from over 30 nationalities. Moreover, he shares his opinions on why he believes interdisciplinarity is more than just a buzzword.

treasury_media.title: Interview Dr. Jalal, the first and only woman to run for presidency in Afghanistan
treasury_media.description:
BA Global Studies students Vincent Tadday and Sophia Longwe interview Dr. Massouda Jalal, former Minister of Women's Affairs, founder of the Jalal foundation, and the first and only woman to run for presidency in Afghanistan. 
On the 22nd of March, she delivered the 3rd Jean Monnet Lecture for the 2021-2022 academic year here in Maastricht at the Faculty of Arts and Social Sciences. 
You can now watch the full interview!

treasury_media.title: FASOS Student Testimonial
treasury_media.description: Would you like to know more about our BSc Global Studies? Current student Vincent Tadday tells us about his experiences with the programme in his latest interview.

treasury_media.title: Reporting back on GS students moderating at OxFID 2022
treasury_media.description: How do we redefine progress? This year’s Oxford Forum for International Development found different answers to this question. The Global Studies students Vincent Tadday and Sophia Longwe were involved in conversations that explored possible options...

treasury_media.title: Global Studies students moderators at OxFID, on 27 February
treasury_media.description: Vincent Tadday and Sophia Longwe, two second-year Global Studies students from UM, will moderate panels during this year’s virtual edition of Oxford Forum for International Development ( OxFID ), one of the largest student-led development conferences...

treasury_media.title: Italy: Who becomes the next President ?
treasury_media.description: On Friday the 21st of January 2022, three days before the Italian parliament began to vote for a new head of state, Res Publica editor Vincent Tadday came together with Tommaso Rabitti to discuss the upcoming election. Tommaso, who is in his 3rd-year undergraduate at King's College London and is writing editorials and opinion papers for the Italian newspaper La Discussione, analysed possible outcomes and scenarios of Italy's 2022 presidential election.

education.field_of_study: German, Sports, Mathematics, History, English & French

contributors.headline: Incoming MPP Candidate at Sciences Po Paris and Hertie School ✔ Co-Founder of Global Studies Community ✔ Young European Ambassador ✔ Editing and writing for Res Publica

profile_positions.description:
The Young European Ambassador (YEAs) initiative was established by the European Union in 2016 as part of the EU Neighbours East Project. YEAs connect young people from the Eastern partnership (EaP) countries: Armenia, Azerbaijan, Belarus, Georgia, the Republic of Moldova, Ukraine with the EU Member States and the United Kingdom. 

*The views expressed on this account are my personal views, and are not associated with my role as a Young European Ambassador.*

Highlights:

- Being an active member of the Partnership and Impact Working Group
- Being part of the Delegation of EU YEA's to Moldova in February 2023
profile_positions.title: Young European Ambassador

profile_positions.description:
CFC is a platform for young people to connect with Senior Policy Makers from the European and African continents. Previous topics addressed by the community included Gender Equality, Green Energy, Modern Slavery, and Democratic Backsliding to name but a few.

For more information please visit: https://www.chathamhouse.org/about-us/our-departments/communications-and-publishing-department/common-futures-conversations
profile_positions.title: Member, Common Future Conversations

profile_positions.description:
As part of the initiating team, my role as Project Coordinator includes the following tasks and responsibilities:
- Co-authoring the proposal for the Maastricht University Diversity & Inclusivity Grant 2022
- Pitching our project proposal in front of the Diversity & Inclusivity Diversity Council
- Establishing different working groups (e.g., communications, logistics outreach, etc.) and ensuring smooth facilitation between the various committees and team members
- Organising internal and external communication with different stakeholders, partners, and students interested in making genuinely inclusive and contemporary university policies
profile_positions.title: Project Coordinator

profile_positions.description: After four months as Content Creator and Editor at Res Publica, I got promoted to Senior Editor. As such, I am part of the editorial board of Res Publica and responsible for editing articles and OpEds for the magazine (both in-print and online publications). Moreover, I work closely with Res Publica's partners all around the world to ensure successful collaborations, such as our "Brexit & Beyond" issue with the Kings College European Society or our "Changemakers Series," in which we conduct interviews with young professionals who strive to make a change through their involvement in society.
profile_positions.title: Senior Editor

profile_positions.description: In winter 2021, I joined the editorial team of Res Publica. The academic platform consists of the Res Publica Politics podcast, the Res Publica magazine and the blog of the same name. Founded in 2020, Res Publica developed into an interdisciplinary magazine of politics, law, art and culture. In my work as an editor, I conduct interviews, write articles and columns and supervise aspiring writers during their writing.
profile_positions.title: Editor

profile_positions.description: In my function as a library student, I supported students with diverse backgrounds in their research and study processes. Here, I learned to cope with people who are experiencing various intensities of stress. Moreover, I helped students deal with ICT issues, create a pleasant study-environment as well as navigate  the various academic resources the UM library has to offer.
profile_positions.title: Student Library Assistant

profile_positions.description: For the academic year 2021/2022, I am appointed as a student member of the Educational Programme Committee (EPC) for the BSc. Global Studies. The comittee consists out of six student representatives and six professors. The role of the Programme Committee is to advise on enhancement and assurance of the quality of the BSc. Global Studies. Moreover, we advise the Programme Director and review the implementation of the education and examination regulations.
profile_positions.title: Member of the Education Programme Committee BSc. Global Studies

profile_positions.description: The Permanent Delegation at UNSA Maastricht is an academic committee, which contains weekly trainings on public speaking, communication, debating, and Model United Nations preparation. The permanent delegation is selected to represent UNSA and EuroMUN at MUN conferences across Europe.
profile_positions.title: Permanent Delegate

profile_positions.description: I prepared and conducted the moderation of the panel on "The Legitimacy of International Intervention" at the Oxford Forum for International Development 2022. I led the discussion between the panel guests Anya Neistat (Clooney Foundation for Justice), Jos Vaessen (World Bank), Devanik Saha (University of Sussex) and Douglas Emeott (Instiglio) on intervening internationally. Together we analysed recent challenges and talked about the responsibilities of the international community as well as about the evaluation of interventions.
profile_positions.title: Moderator

profile_positions.description: I am proud to be appointed as a Student Ambassador for Oxford Forum for International Development 2022. OxFID is one of the largest student-led development conferences in Europe. Since 2008, the Oxford-based conference enables students to participate in conversations and collaborations with stakeholders involved in international development. This years them is: “Aurora: Redefining Progress and Navigating Transition”.
profile_positions.title: Ambassador

profile_positions.description: The Global Studies Community is the study association of all BSc. Global Studies students at Maastricht University. The association provides academic and social extracurriculars for their members, coming from over 30 different nationalities. In my position as treasurer and member of the executive board, I was responsible for the financial administration. Furthermore, I was involved in the development and organisation of academic and social events like lecture series and workshops.
profile_positions.title: Head Of Finance

profile_positions.description: In September 2020, I was part of a group of four highly motivated students who got elected to found a study association for the new BSc. Global Studies. We built up the administrative structures like a bank account, accounting structures as well as social media accounts. Moreover we developed a vision for the academic year.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder
